title: Why do I get goosebumps when I hear an old song that brings back memories? - Quora

response.answer_text: There is actually a word for this. Frisson. It seems that this is likely a result of dopamine release. I'm no scientist, and I don't want to burther any paraphrasing so I'll include some links http://www.nature.com/neuro/journal/v14/n2/full/nn.2726.htmlTurns out that music really is intoxicating, after allScholar explores mystery of the 'music-evoked frisson'http://www.cogsci.msu.edu/DSS/2008-2009/Huron/HuronFrisson.pdf - PDF warning
